organization.$: Center for Petroleum, Petrochemical, and Advanced Materials

head.citation-title: Combined plasma reforming of CO2-containing natural gas with steam and partial oxidation in a multistage gliding arc discharge system: Effect of stage number
head.abstracts: The effect of stage number of multistage gliding arc discharge system on the process performance of combined steam reforming and partial oxidation of simulated natural gas was studied. The simulated natural gas contained 70% methane, 5% ethane, 5% propane, and 20% CO2. An increase in stage number from 1 to 3 stages at a constant feed flow rate enhanced the reactant conversions, and H2 yield with the reduction of energy consumption. The optimum energy consumption was elucidated. This is an abstract of a paper presented at the CHISA 2012 - 20th International Congress of Chemical and Process Engineering and PRES 2012 - 15th Conference PRES (Prague, Czech Republic 8/25-29/2012).
